record.title: EXTENSION OF MORNING BUSINESS
record.narrative:
EXTENSION OF MORNING BUSINESS -- (Senate - November 20, 2008)

[Page: S10687]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the time for morning business be extended until 12 noon, with Senators permitted to speak for up to 10 minutes each.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I suggest the absence of a quorum.

record.chair: The clerk will call the roll.
The assistant legislative clerk proceeded to call the roll.
The Senator from Florida is recognized.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the order for the quorum call be rescinded.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, is the Senate in morning business?

record.chair: It is. The Senator from Florida is recognized.
record.narrative: (The remarks of Mr. Nelson of Florida pertaining to the introduction of S. Con. Res. 106 are located in today's Record under "Statements on Introduced Bills and Joint Resolutions.")

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I yield the floor, and I suggest the absence of a quorum.

record.chair: The clerk will call the roll.
The assistant legislative clerk proceeded to call the roll.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the order for the quorum call be rescinded.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, what is the parliamentary situation? Is the Senator from Virginia able to address the Senate?

record.chair: The Senate is in a period of morning business.

speaking.paragraph: I ask unanimous consent to proceed for no more than 5 minutes.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
